reviews.title: Needs refurbishment... but rooms will still be tiny.
reviews.text: I am Marriott Platinum Elite and I travel to Jacksonville regularly on business and usually stay at the Marriott Sawgrass in Ponte Vedra (much much nicer). The Sawgrass was sold out for a few nights during the beginning of the week, so I decided to give the Marriott JAX a try. I booked a room on the Club level because the rooms are supposed to be new and on the top floor with the lounge.

reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Stay
reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel and found no doorman or bell hop and no Club room. I was given a tomb on the 4th floor. The room was tiny and dank with a painted brown wall and a dirty old dark green carpet. Wallpaper was peeling from the walls and the drywall was buckling in the bathroom. The furniture was old and looked like it had seen its day. It was probably purchased at fire sale from an old hotel or maybe even at a yard sale. The drawers would stick when you tried to open and so I put nothing in them. The TV did not come in an armoire. It was placed on top of the chest of drawers. The linens on the bed were of a very low quality and felt very uncomfortable to sleep in.

reviews.title: Jacksonville Marriott up to par
reviews.text: I did have dinner in the Bistro and the waitress was missing teeth, but very nice. Dinner was very good, but later gave me acid indigestion and I almost vomited later that night. The next day the Chef sent cookies to my room thanking me for dining in his restaurant... how nice.

reviews.title: Not Impressed
reviews.text: My company paid $199 per night for this room... YES.. $199 a night in Jacksonville??!!??!!! This should be an $89 a night room without the problems.

reviews.title: Pretty Nice
reviews.text: First let me say that if I paid $89 for this room I would have been satisfied. I will just go through the list now of why this place was not good, and very dissapointing for a Marriott (which my second favorite chain next to Embassy Suites).

reviews.title: Great rooms, so-so location
reviews.text: 1) for $199 a night, I was given what was clearly a priceline room. On the second floor, just over the roof line of a function room and facing a wall (about 30 feet in front of me). Beautiful view...NOT!

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.text: 2) The handle on the toilet kept popping off when I tried to flush it, and stuck out about 4 inches from the side of the toilet unless you pushed it in.

reviews.title: Lowered Expectations...
reviews.text: 3) Sink would not drain properly. Kept overflowing.

This is a nice hotel that I find is suitable only to business travelers. I can’t see any other reason to stay here other than business, as the hotel is located in the nearby of a business park together with several others, and to me this place looks like the middle of nowhere. Nice green areas, but no attractions in the nearby and the closest shopping mall is about 10 USD away by taxi.
reviews.title: Nice hotel!

reviews.text: Anyway, I come here at least once a year just for work and the Jacksonville Marriott fits perfectly to my needs. As I use it only to wash myself and sleep, I find that rooms are spacious, very comfortable, very clean and equipped with big flat screen TVs. Food is also good and better than other Marriotts I have visited.
reviews.title: Very dated, needs an upgrade
Better than average Marriott
reviews.text: Thank goodness my stay was a company paid expense. The inside is very old and dated. The bathrooms are just awful. Shower doesn't work, water smells like sulfur. The staff were ok and the buffet breakfast was good, but not a recommended property for a family vacation, and ok for business if you don't spend much time in your room.

This Marriott is in an area with a whole bunch of other hotels, but the setting is very pretty - lots of trees and even a small pond. It's a very nice property with a knowledgeable staff. The only negative is the dining - same old boring Marriott food, but there are lots of good restaurants within a short drive.
reviews.title: Great for Biz Travelers

reviews.text: Great place for biz travelers. Fast check-in and good room service. There were many golfers staying here, so there must be some good courses. Flat screen TV was pretty nice too!
reviews.title: Nice Marriott for business travelers.
